slokas: अर्जुन उवाचये शास्त्रविधिमुत्सृज्य यजन्ते श्रद्धयान्विता: ।तेषां निष्ठा तु का कृष्ण सत्त्वमाहो रजस्तम: ॥ १ ॥
slokas_translated: Arjuna said: What is the position of those who, disregarding the scriptural injunctions, worship with faith? Is it in goodness, passion, or ignorance, O Krishna?

slokas: श्रीभगवानुवाचत्रिविधा भवति श्रद्धा देहिनां सा स्वभावजा ।सात्त्विकी राजसी चैव तामसी चेति तां श‍ृणु ॥ २ ॥
slokas_translated: The Blessed Lord said: The faith of embodied beings is of three kinds, born of their own nature: the sattvic, the rajasic, and the tamasic. Listen to it.

slokas: सत्त्वानुरूपा सर्वस्य श्रद्धा भवति भारत ।श्रद्धामयोऽयं पुरुषो यो यच्छ्रद्ध: स एव स: ॥ ३ ॥
slokas_translated: For everyone, faith is in accordance with their nature, O Bharata. A person is made of faith; as is their faith, so they are.

slokas: यजन्ते सात्त्विका देवान्यक्षरक्षांसि राजसा: ।प्रेतान्भूतगणांश्चान्ये यजन्ते तामसा जना: ॥ ४ ॥
slokas_translated: The virtuous worship the gods, the passionate worship the demigods and demons, and others, who are of darkness, worship spirits and ghosts.

slokas: अशास्त्रविहितं घोरं तप्यन्ते ये तपो जना: ।दम्भाहङ्कारसंयुक्ता: कामरागबलान्विता: ॥ ५ ॥
slokas_translated: People who perform severe penances not prescribed by the scriptures, who are full of hypocrisy and ego, and who are driven by the strength of lust and attachment.

slokas: कर्षयन्त: शरीरस्थं भूतग्राममचेतस: ।मां चैवान्त: शरीरस्थं तान्विद्ध्यासुरनिश्चयान् ॥ ६ ॥
slokas_translated: Those who torture the group of elements in the body and me also, who dwell within the body, know them to be of demonic resolve.

slokas: आहारस्त्वपि सर्वस्य त्रिविधो भवति प्रिय: ।यज्ञस्तपस्तथा दानं तेषां भेदमिमं श‍ृणु ॥ ७ ॥
slokas_translated: Food, too, is of three kinds and is dear to everyone. So also are sacrifice, austerity, and charity. Hear the distinction among them. (Verse 7)

slokas: आयु:सत्त्वबलारोग्यसुखप्रीतिविवर्धना: ।रस्या: स्‍निग्धा: स्थिरा हृद्या आहारा: सात्त्विकप्रिया: ॥ ८ ॥
slokas_translated: Foods that increase life, vitality, strength, health, happiness, and satisfaction, which are juicy, nourishing, stable, and pleasing to the heart, are dear to those who are of a sattvic nature.

slokas: कट्‌वम्ललवणात्युष्णतीक्ष्णरूक्षविदाहिन: ।आहारा राजसस्येष्टा दु:खशोकामयप्रदा: ॥ ९ ॥
slokas_translated: Foods that are bitter, sour, salty, excessively hot, pungent, dry, and burning are dear to those in the mode of passion. They cause pain, sorrow, and disease.

slokas: यातयामं गतरसं पूति पर्युषितं च यत् ।उच्छिष्टमपि चामेध्यं भोजनं तामसप्रियम् ॥ १० ॥
slokas_translated: Stale, tasteless, putrid, decomposed, and impure food, as well as leftovers, are dear to those in the mode of ignorance.

slokas: अफलाकाङ्‌‍क्षिभिर्यज्ञो विधिदिष्टो य इज्यते ।यष्टव्यमेवेति मन: समाधाय स सात्त्विक: ॥ ११ ॥
slokas_translated: The sacrifice that is performed according to the directions of scripture, by those who do not desire any reward and who have fixed their mind on the duty of sacrifice, is of the nature of goodness.

slokas: अभिसन्धाय तु फलं दम्भार्थमपि चैव यत् ।इज्यते भरतश्रेष्ठ तं यज्ञं विद्धि राजसम् ॥ १२ ॥
slokas_translated: The sacrifice which is offered, O best of the Bharatas, seeking a reward and for the sake of ostentation, know that sacrifice to be in the mode of passion.

slokas: विधिहीनमसृष्टान्नं मन्‍त्रहीनमदक्षिणम् ।श्रद्धाविरहितं यज्ञं तामसं परिचक्षते ॥ १३ ॥
slokas_translated: A sacrifice which is devoid of proper rites, where no food is distributed, which lacks hymns and offerings, and is devoid of faith, is considered to be in the mode of ignorance.

slokas: देवद्विजगुरुप्राज्ञपूजनं शौचमार्जवम् ।ब्रह्मचर्यमहिंसा च शारीरं तप उच्यते ॥ १४ ॥
slokas_translated: Worship of the gods, the twice-born, the teachers, and the wise, purity, straightforwardness, celibacy, and non-violence are called bodily austerity.

slokas: अनुद्वेगकरं वाक्यं सत्यं प्रियहितं च यत् ।स्वाध्यायाभ्यसनं चैव वाङ्‍मयं तप उच्यते ॥ १५ ॥
slokas_translated: Speech that is non-agitating, truthful, pleasant, and beneficial, as well as the practice of self-study, is called verbal austerity.

slokas: मन:प्रसाद: सौम्यत्वं मौनमात्मविनिग्रह: ।भावसंश‍ुद्धिरित्येतत्तपो मानसमुच्यते ॥ १६ ॥
slokas_translated: Serenity of mind, gentleness, silence, self-control, and purity of disposition—this is called mental austerity.

slokas: श्रद्धया परया तप्‍तं तपस्तत्‍त्रिविधं नरै: ।अफलाकाङ्‌‍क्षिभिर्युक्तै: सात्त्विकं परिचक्षते ॥ १७ ॥
slokas_translated: The threefold austerity performed with supreme faith by men who are disciplined and without desire for reward is said to be of the nature of goodness (sattvic).

slokas: सत्कारमानपूजार्थं तपो दम्भेन चैव यत् ।क्रियते तदिह प्रोक्तं राजसं चलमध्रुवम् ॥ १८ ॥
slokas_translated: The austerity that is performed for the sake of gaining respect, honor, and worship, with hypocrisy, is said to be of the nature of rajas, unstable and impermanent.

slokas: मूढग्राहेणात्मनो यत्पीडया क्रियते तप: ।परस्योत्सादनार्थं वा तत्तामसमुदाहृतम् ॥ १९ ॥
slokas_translated: The austerity that is performed with foolish obstinacy, causing self-torture or for the purpose of destroying others, is said to be of the nature of darkness (tamas).

slokas: दातव्यमिति यद्दानं दीयतेऽनुपकारिणे ।देशे काले च पात्रे च तद्दानं सात्त्विकं स्मृतम् ॥ २० ॥
slokas_translated: The gift that is given out of duty, at the proper time and place, to a worthy person, without expectation of return, is considered to be in the mode of goodness.

slokas: यत्तु प्रत्युपकारार्थं फलमुद्दिश्य वा पुन: ।दीयते च परिक्ल‍ि‍ष्टं तद्दानं राजसं स्मृतम् ॥ २१ ॥
slokas_translated: That gift which is given with the expectation of something in return, or with a desire for a reward, or reluctantly, is remembered as a gift in the mode of passion.

slokas: अदेशकाले यद्दानमपात्रेभ्यश्च दीयते ।असत्कृतमवज्ञातं तत्तामसमुदाहृतम् ॥ २२ ॥
slokas_translated: The gift that is given at an improper place and time, to unworthy persons, without respect or with disdain, is declared to be of the nature of darkness (Tamas).

slokas: ॐ तत्सदिति निर्देशो ब्रह्मणस्त्रिविध: स्मृत: ।ब्राह्मणास्तेन वेदाश्च यज्ञाश्च विहिता: पुरा ॥ २३ ॥
slokas_translated: Om, the term "Tat Sat" is considered as a threefold designation of Brahman. By that were the Brahmanas, the Vedas, and the sacrifices ordained in the past.

slokas: तस्माद् ॐ इत्युदाहृत्य यज्ञदानतप:क्रिया: ।प्रवर्तन्ते विधानोक्ता: सततं ब्रह्मवादिनाम् ॥ २४ ॥
slokas_translated: Therefore, with the utterance of "Om," the acts of sacrifice, charity, and austerity, as enjoined by the scriptures, are always commenced by the practitioners of the Vedas.

slokas: तदित्यनभिसन्धाय फलं यज्ञतप:क्रिया: ।दानक्रियाश्च विविधा: क्रियन्ते मोक्षकाङ्‌‍क्षिभि: ॥ २५ ॥
slokas_translated: "That is performed without desiring the results, the acts of sacrifice, austerity, and various acts of charity are undertaken by those who seek liberation."

slokas: सद्भ‍ावे साधुभावे च सदित्येतत्प्रयुज्यते ।प्रशस्ते कर्मणि तथा सच्छब्द: पार्थ युज्यते ॥ २६ ॥
slokas_translated: The word "Sat" is used in the sense of reality and goodness, O Partha, and so also, it is used in the sense of an auspicious act.

slokas: यज्ञे तपसि दाने च स्थिति: सदिति चोच्यते ।कर्म चैव तदर्थीयं सदित्येवाभिधीयते ॥ २७ ॥
slokas_translated: In sacrifice, austerity, and charity, the steadfastness is said to be "Sat." And also, the action for that purpose is indeed called "Sat." (Verse 27)

slokas: अश्रद्धया हुतं दत्तं तपस्तप्‍तं कृतं च यत् ।असदित्युच्यते पार्थ न च तत्प्रेत्य नो इह ॥ २८ ॥
slokas_translated: The offering given without faith, the gift, the austerity, and whatever is performed without faith, is called "asat," O Partha. It is of no value here or hereafter.
